Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, great location and charming atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CC94
Reviews.Content: This restored pair of historical hotels is in an ideal location for Convention Center and Gaslamp/downtown area. The decor is interesting and very refreshing compared to the huge super hotels. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I had an early morning flight, and when I came downstairs at 4:30 they had my hotel receipt printed and laid out for me to pick up and the cab was already waiting, although it was 10-15 min before I had asked to have a cab. Cafe 222 is just in the next block, and a diagonal cut through the public parking lot next to it takes you right to the Marriott end of the convention center. It was only a few blocks from the 5th st bridge over the tracks. The only downsides are that the internet was not the fastest (but it was included in the convention hotel rate, and the convention center internet was not much faster). There is no fitness center or pool, but with the waterfront so close for long walks and runs, that was not an issue. The hot shower was fully adequate, but not the strong massaging jets you might get elsewhere. There is an elevator past the open air courtyard in the middle. Very charming and conveniently located with interesting decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MNMomAppleValley_MN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Historic Gaslamp district which is wonderful. Right next to a Starbucks. The room was very clean and very accomodating and friendly staff. There was no onsight business center and the property is very "dated" versus historical in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: TDB13
Reviews.Content: Pretty Hotel. Nicely decorated to keep in line with History. Great Balcony. Heating and cooling worked well. Bed Comfortable with extra pillows. Amenities Lacking. Would be good for romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Nbetts31
Reviews.Content: Their was no welcome, just a how can I help you with barely looking up from what ever task was more important than checking in a guest. Later in the day went to buy a soda at the cafe and took nearly 10 minutes to allow me to pay for the beverage. Can't wait to see how the rest of the stay goes.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint”
Reviews.Author: Schield W
Reviews.Content: Unique hotel in gaslamp district of San Diego. Everybody working in the hotel and restaurant did everything possible to take care of our needs. Very friendly staff. The hotel is unique. It brings you back to another era.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: rpwalter
Reviews.Content: The horton was an older hotel with historic feeling. Stayed in a single bed room that had a balcony that overlooked the courtyard. The room had a very nice working gas fireplace in the room and the bathroom has old fashion toilet fixtures. Rooms were clean but as an older hotel, you can hear all the noises for outside and rooms next to you and above.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously quirky”
Reviews.Author: DebbyClaire
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this hotel, but it's not easy. Certainly the location is fabulous for conventioneers, a couple of blocks from the convention center and right on the edge of the Gaslamp District for easy access to restaurants. And despite numerous complaints from other visitors about the uncaring staff, I thought they were just fine, friendly, chatty and helpful, just not particularly 'corporate'. They didnt seem like career hoteliers, just nice folks. The lobby was a study in floral upholstered wicker and freezing cold during my visit. The in- house restaurant was fine for breakfast, although we found the Cafe 222 down the street to be much better. It was the rooms that made it so difficult, as they weren't just old fashioned, they were run down and positively reeked of mold. It's the first time I have ever felt that I had to go out and buy a scented candle, which didn't help all that much. When I asked the maintenance guy who came to show me how to adjust the temperamental room thermostat if all the rooms were so stinky, he told me that it was from new carpeting and curtains. But we all know what new smells like, and this wasn't it. The oddly shaped bathrooms had pedestal sinks without adequate room for toiletries, and the shower head was installed at such a low height it was barely manageable even for me, 5 foot 0 inches. The much touted in-room fireplaces have a single candlesized gas flame burning in a corner without even the benefit of some fake logs. The bed was comfortable. Had the owners tossed the synthetic gold colored 1960s Howard Johnson's looking bedspreads and gone with patchwork quilts or Victorian lace, the whole atmosphere would have been upgraded while staying in theme. And felt a great deal cleaner. For a hotel that caters so frequently to conventioneers, greater effort should be put into providing free or affordable wifi and adequate smartphone charging stations. Still, the atmosphere was so homey, so much like staying in an old house, that I adjusted quickly and focused on the coziness rather than the annoyances. I don't think it would necessarily be my first choice for a return visit, but at the $130 convention rate, neither would I object.

Reviews.Title: “Room away from the Nightclub”
Reviews.Author: cosmodog
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is lovely with a beautiful lobby. The rooms have some antique features and are very comfortable. On each landing is a piano that you will wish was not there when guests start playing it at 1:30 in the morning.If you want to get some sleep on Fridays and Saturdays ask for a room away from the street facing the Flex nightclub. We did not but they moved us(smaller room than we paid for ) when we asked.

Reviews.Title: “A fun getaway with family and an added bonus in room 309. Great for Halloween....BOO!”
Reviews.Author: sharon m
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in a large chain hotel for two days and decided to switch to the Grand Horton for our last night. We wish we had known earlier how nice this hotel was we certainly would have preferred the Grand Horton. Loved it, loved it, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel - Gaslamp close to Conv. Ctr”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel within 5 minutes walking distance of San Diego Convention Ctr, lots of restaurants and stadium. Hotel has great wood, fireplace in room and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Of historical interest, but...”
Reviews.Author: Jan981
Reviews.Content: Great location...very interesting history and lovely period decor...however, with one exception service was very poor and staff appeared unfriendly and apathetic to needs of customers. Disappointing, compared with responsive staff at The Westgate and Hosteling International in the Gaslamp area!

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Future”
Reviews.Author: Aceaceace
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand Hotel A nice trip back into 1800's. The entire hotel was scheduled to be demolished in the 1970's and was sold for $1 by the City of San Diego to investors who took it apart brick by brick, labeled each piece and then reconstructed it on a different site (were it is now). It is a nice hybrid of the past and the present. Room: November 11, 2011. We stayed in a room on the 4th floor overlooking the quaint courtyard + it had a nice view of the city rooftops. We sat on the balcony which was big enough for 2 people just above the top of the trees in the courtyard, and could hear the hustle and bustle of the gaslamp quarters in San Diego. There are two widows walks one on the right and one on the left, so it really is a trip back in time. Beware on a Friday night there are lots of sirens anywhere in the gas lamp area till the bars close. The room had a bay window, an old fashion TV, which we didn't watch anyway, since we sat on the balcony. The King size bed was nice and I slept good. The water pressure was good, and my only complaint was the shower head was installed by a 5 foot tall plumber and hit me in my belly. If the Horton people are reading this, please note you can purchase a nice shiny chrome curved show head extension that will raise the shower head by 18 inches for $25. Also, one other thing to fix, the handles on the sink don't have stops, so you have to fiddle with the handles to get the water to shut off. Maybe this is the way the faucets used to work way back in the 1800's and that is why they have those still? Restaurants: There are 75 restaurants within easy walking distance and many storefronts are open till 9. Kiddy corner to the Horton is a nice but pricey store with beautiful handmade glass art pieces. We strolled blocks and blocks from the Horton around the gas lamp area and felt safe the entire time. After inspecting many restaurant menu's we decided to eat dinner at the Blue Point restaurant and sat outside under a very nice heater. The Blue Point is a little expensive, but I think most of the restaurants in the area are about the same price. If you go to the Blue Point at 565 Fifth Avenue ask if Abby is working and sit in her area outside under the heater. Haunting: While we were our room on the 4th floor, I learned that room 309 is supposedly haunted, as well as the hallway outside of room 309. I found the room, which was just around the corner and down some nice antique stairs. I stood outside room 309 for a bit, but to my disappointment nothing happened. Although if something had happened I would have fallen down the next staircase. Self guided tour: If you do stay at the Horton Grand, make sure you ride up the elevator to the left, it has a nice surprise on the 3rd and 4th floor. Also, note the fine craftsmanship inside the elevator. It must weigh a ton as it is 100% wood. Walk all around the hotel and find the grand staircase which was shipped to Europe and reconstructed for a cost of $200,000 when the hotel was reconstructed. I loved that the hotel had two exterior walkways to another old building on the 2nd and 4th floor. The Hotel is actually 2 buildings combined into one via the walkways. Also, visit the courtyard, and see the fountain, and the lighted trees. There is no pool and no hot tub, so don't bring your swimming suit. There are lots and lots of historical photos hanging on the walls near the lobby, take a look at them. Parking: We paid $25 for parking for 1 day, then to park a few more hours past noon was another $14. They have valet parking. Amtrak: We almost took Amtrak from L.A. area to San Diego. It would have been $23 one way from Fullerton, CA about 100 miles, and would have only taken 30 minutes more than driving. Amtrak is just over a half mile from the Horton, and if we had taken a taxi from Amtrak it would have cost less than the parking. You could also walk from Amtrak to the Horton in about 10 minutes. Next time we are going to take the train. Actually on the way back we hit a huge traffic jam that took over 1 hour to go 10 miles, so the train would have been faster on the way back, and less stressful. Summary: I want to stay here again someday. The new modern Hilton is 3 blocks away next to the convention center, and the cost is about the same, but why would you want something so futuristic when you can have something so nicely old and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Lovely”
Reviews.Author: ReleaseT
Reviews.Content: If you have a love for eclectic and value charm, you will like this hotel. First off and most importantly in my opinion - the hotel staff is very kind and attentive. Second, the location is absolutely perfect - especially if you are attending a conference at the convention center - it is only a couple blocks away, and it's very close to great restaurants, bars, and convenience stores. The decor is extremely interesting - think antique, elegant, possibly haunted (at least that seems to be what they're going for, though I never felt the presence of spirits or anything spooky during my stay). The elevator is old hydrolic style - slow and it smells like an old Grandma's perfume. The elevator slowly passes by windows into little rooms done up with really old items and dolls - interesting. The hotel room was comfortable and on the small side. My TV unfortunately had a small crack in it that was slightly annoying. The walls were dreadfully thin and you can hear every conversation of the people in the room next to you - but nothing the TV or earplugs won't drown out (so it didn't bother me). The bathroom was unique - it had an old style toilet with the water chamber up high and a pull chain to flush. The tub seemed newer and was nice and clean. In fact, the whole room was pretty clean. Overall I was very pleased with my stay. The only thing that frustrated me, may deter you from staying, and was the reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars was the fact that the wireless internet was terrible - they had an outside company handling it, so forget customer service and even though I paid a lot to have it for the week, it kept dropping out shortly after connecting. Don't expect to be able to work much on your laptop while you are here. It may be a common thing among all the hotels in the area, I just don't know. Other than the internet issue, it's quite a nice hotel and much better priced than the other hotels in the same geographic location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the beautiful vintage trick you”
Reviews.Content: Yes, the style of the hotel is absolutely amazing, and the furnitures and bathrooms are really beautiful. The positives stops there. The service is hideous. Only one person working on at the front desk, and that person also has to take care of other stuff, like parking. One night I was trying to call down to ask for a late check-out. I called multiple times for 2 hours, and nobody answered. That is totally unacceptable to me. They also turned of the water at 10am one day without any warning. They didn't seem too sorry about it when I called down. The fireplace looks nice, but when you light it, it only has a stupid little flame, not much more than a candle could make, and it just looks depressing..... $25 for parking is really a joke. This is not New York City... And $10 per night for internet PER DEVICE is totally ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: barbie1949
Reviews.Content: It was like a step back in time staying at the Horton Grand, I really imagined I was in a wild west saloon! The rooms were gorgeous, tastefully done in the Victorian era with all the comforts of modern day. Ours had a lovely balcony to overlook the city. Also a cosy gas fireplace. The staff were welcoming and friendly and the price very affordable. It was handy for the waterfront and the Historic Gaslamp district We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and great location!”
Reviews.Author: cmcaudillo
Reviews.Content: This supposedly "haunted" hotel is a totally different experience. I paid about 1/3 of the price of others attending the same conference. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the convention center, it is across from a night club and very close to the best restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp Quarter. The location is excellent!! Do take earplugs for a Saturday night stay because the nightclub is loud and is open until 4am. I didn't have a problem with it because I read reviews prior to my stay and was prepared. The hotel gave me a bit of the vibe from "The Shining" movie, especially if you take a wrong turn or go to the wrong wing of the hotel, but it is such an interesting place to stay. It is not filled with the newest and best furnishings, but it embraces its history. The toilet really has a pull chain to flush it, the tv is hidden behind a gilded mirror above the fireplace. I absolutely loved the balcony, though never figured out how to turn on the fireplace (it wasn't really cold, I just wanted to try it). The room was clean and the one time I went back to my room for a nap and put up the "do not disturb" sign, I was later called to see if I would have liked my room cleaned. Do not count on the restaurant being open, but you don't have to with so many fabulous places nearby. There is a World Market store a block and a half away if you would like a bottle of wine, it would be cheaper than buying a glass anyhow. I will stay at this hotel again when I go back to San Diego for the value and the interesting experience of having an "out of the box" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Happy_Feet
Reviews.Content: If you want something other than the usual four walls, I recommend the Horton Grand. First of all, its location is very good. While securely in the Gaslamp area, it is toward the west of the area, and so is an easy walk to the convention center - about 5 minutes. The rooms are nicely decorated, and we found the bed to be acceptable, neither hard as rock nor soft. Most rooms have a small balcony with two chairs and a working gas fireplace, although they really need to repaint the chairs. I would not sit on them. The bathrooms are more than adequate and are attractive. We never had an issue with hot water - there was plenty. The toiletries provided were above average. It is an old hotel, so you get a lot of charm. Like all things in life, there is the other side of the coin. Because the hotel is antique, there are some expectations you must suspend. Soundproof rooms are among those. We could hear every sound, other than voice, from the room above us (consider requesting the fourth floor). There are no mini-bars or coffee machines in the hotel. They will have room service soon but they do not now. Having room service and a seven-days-a-week, regularly open restaurant will help tremendously. Our understanding is that this is in the works and will be a reality soon. Internet is not free but it is not badly priced either at $29.95 for 4 days; there is a 7 day package also. There is a Starbucks right around the corner, so you can access the Internet there if you don't want to pay. The staff were very friendly to chat with, and we enjoyed talking with them. Customer service could be improved in these ways. First, we were not given much information when we arrived. We didn't even know until the morning we left that there was coffee in the lobby. There were no suggestions for restaurants, etc. We arrived way early, and they kindly checked our bags for us. They were very accommodating, and had our room ready two hours early. We can hardly complain about our treatment in that regard. However, when I tried to inquire as to suggestions for where we could have lunch or otherwise pass a few hours until we could check in, I was pretty much ignored. We left, wandered around, and ate at an ok but really expensive place that we found. Second, and I know this will seem nit-picking but it was pretty important to us at the time, they had no change for metered parking outside. We had to rent a car for a couple days for some dress-up events, and, right after we picked up the car, had to park the car for an hour while we changed into our fancy clothes. When I asked for change for the meters, I was fairly well dismissed, and told, no, we don't have any change. I expect more, I admit it. The Poogs and I were able to scrounge together enough change for 20 minutes, so we ran upstairs and changed pronto. In case you don't know, there is no non-metered parking in the Gaslamp area. That experience really stuck with me, I think because they weren't very nice about it and seemed put out that I would even ask. There wasn't really a place around there where we could get change without making it a hike. And, honestly, I really didn't need to rush when I had to be dressed up, made up, and have twinkles in my eyes. If you are young, and have not stayed in old hotels like the Horton, you should do so, at least once. There is an elevator, which is more than I can say for many of the old hotels I have stayed in over the years. As old farts, I think our boutique-y, antique hotel days might be over. I love having a coffee machine in my sound-proof room when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and Charm”
Reviews.Author: Colinscott779
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand is a superior mix of old world charm and modern day luxury. An eclectic selection of memorabilia (including a life size papier mache horse) enhances the Victorian style interior, complete with an interior courtyard and balconies. There is a comfortable sense of stepping back into the past while sacrificing nothing by way of comfort. As befits such a haven of tranquility, the staff are courteous and friendly. The location is as good as it gets. Situated in the Gaslamp district with all its gastronomic opportunities and sources of fun (opposite a location once used to film an episode of the TV series Silk Stalkings), it is a short stroll from the marina, Seaport and close to the Horton shopping mall. This is no 'Gin Palace' for the in-crowd but if you want a pleasant and relaxing stay in San Diego wrapped in an aura of dated elegance, the Horton Grand is going to be your first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Historic - If there are ghosts there's got to be some here somewhere”
Reviews.Author: TheZipMeister
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel during an annual business trip to San Diego. Though I've stayed at some of the higher level "resort" hotels on the bay (e.g. Marriott), I've been lately staying at smaller, more intimate hotels in order to reduce costs (the govt. rate hasn't really kept up with reality in areas like San Diego) as well as to blend in more with the local culture. If you've been to San Diego, and done their "bus" tour, you'll know the Horton as the one with all the innate, ironwork composing the facade of the building, and also that it is probably one of the older "classy" hotels in this area having been built by Mr. Horton, who made his fortune developing this area back when San Diego was a lot of mud. Obviously, now it's a land of million-dollar condos, glitz, sun, and really nice weather, not to mention a serious marina-like enviornment with great seafood. I liked my stay here. On the plus side,..this is one really old and authentic hotel. You can almost feel the ghosts in this building, and I'm sure if they exist, they've been very hospitable. It seems most of the architecture is original from the fireplaces and bathroom fixtures, to the chairs and furniture scattered throughout. The main stairway is something out of the Stephen King "Shining" movie. If you walk around here at night, you're feeling like you might run into a ghost, or at least, that you're being watched. Like some other reviews, I did notice that the staff is just a bit under pressure during the 10AM - 2PM time slot, but otherwise, I found them very pleasant and helpful. I did not have a car. Early morning and evenings, the staff was very friendly. I had a good conversation with a couple of them this week about how our IRAs and 401Ks had dropped about 20% during the last week. They didn't seem to mind that I actually worked for the government either. Really, just down-to-earth, real people with no pretences. Staff at some of the "resort" hotels around here can seem a bit too plastic for me. The restaurant was "down" during my 3 night stay. A bummer since I DO like a good breakfast to start my working day out, but Starbucks was 1 block away. The rooms are comfortable. Big bathrooms (just like in the good old days) with a separate door. The bed was very comfortable. Rooms have good airconditioning as well as a ceiling fan, making for a very good nights sleep. No coffee makers in the room, but there's a fresh pot in the lobby. The location is superb. Since it's really on 4th and thus, 1 block off 5th which is where the action focuses, I found it very quiet and peaceful. It's only about 4-5 stories high also, which shelters it completely from the tram lines. The latter by the way, are pretty bad if you stay at the big resorts (like the Marriott). Walking distance to the marina and anything else you'd want to do in this part of town. There is no gym. There are drink and ice machines to cool off with. Too bad about the restaurant. It looks really cool with all the authentic, victorian-like furniture, original artwork and scultures, and millwork. If the restaurant was working, then I'd have had a perfect time. From what I understand, the restaurant usually serves breakfast/lunch, but I seem to recall that dinner is not served (which is okay,..there are great restaurants located nearby (try the Thai at Rama's, about 1 block away). The maid service was superb. Rooms were super clean. I had no problems with anything of this sort. In summary, if you're into history and like old hotels, stary here. You'll have hours of exploring to do. The courtyard is something I've not seen before. Very authentic again, and quite charming. I would recommend though calling ahead to find out about the restaurant. Having even a coffee maker in the room would have been nice. Very quiet. I had some hours to kill, and enjoyed myself, just laying in bed and finishing a novel I'd brought with. Wireless was reasonably good. It was about 9.95 per day,..or 40 bucks for a week I think. This is a typical fee around here. The elevator works well. On one side, you can look out into little museum-like displays as you're riding it up and down. Overall, a very pleasant stay. Not for the jet-set. Appropriate for those who want to take life a bit slower and appreciate history.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: Robby9999
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in a fantastic location with the Gaslamp Quarter strolling distance. But there are a couple of things about the hotel that were very frustrating, Wifi is an additional $10 per day per device! My wife and I both have a notebook, and an iphone, so $40 per day is a joke. Walk out the main entrance, turn right, walk to the corner, then turn left. Walk 50 yards, and you will find a Starbucks with free wifi! Next ripoff was the parking. $25 per day is over the top. If you walk out the main entrance, turn left and walk a block, you will find a carpark with reasonable rates. No fridge in the room, and the carpet was old, damp and smelly. The old TV was discovered by accident, located behind a mirror above the fireplace. We booked this via a website that mentioned a nice bar, but this was closed while we were there. Not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dawn R
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two week trip in California that ended in San Diego. We booked the Horton Grand on Trip Advisor reviews and recommendations, and were not disappointed. The hotel is in an excellent location - just on the border of the Gaslamp Quarter District - home to hundreds of restaurants, bars and shops. Another couple that joined us was participating in a conference at the Convention Center and it was a perfect location for that as well. The hotel was decorated in a Victorian Theme -- and was very tastefully done - a lot of beautiful antiques! The rooms were a decent size and very clean. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was cool - pull chain to flush the toilet! Our room also had a fireplace. Staff was very accommodating. Our room was located on the right side of hotel (Room #307) - it was very quiet. The friends who were traveling with us were on the left side of the hotel (Room #427) and they said the nightlife out their window to the early morning hours was a little tough to get used to (there's a very big club right across the street on the corner of 4th St and Island Ave) so if noise bothers you I would suggest you ask to be on the right side of the hotel. As tourist we did the typical tourist attractions - one being the Olde Towne Trolley Tour....it couldn't have been more perfect as the trolley stop was right out our front door. (PS - the trolley was a great way to get some history on San Diego as well as see all the :hotspots - we highly recommend it!) We were pleased with the hotel and we would definitely stay at the Horton again if we ever get back to visit San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “GHASTLY DIRTY AND IN NEED OF RENOVATION”
Reviews.Author: roya_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are poky and dingy with bedding that has seen better days: old foam filled pillows, acrylic blankets and dusty covers and dust ruffles. The rooms stink and the windows do not open. The few rooms with opening doors look straight onto a noisy nightclub. I would advise the traveler to look elsewhere. THis is not the quaint antique filled boutique hotel it is made out to be. It needs a thorough renovation. Looks great on the outside, long lines at check in, a valet who does not care and service that is lackluster.

Reviews.Title: “only good for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: jwoody
Reviews.Content: I lived in San Diego for 15 years and it wasn't until i moved away and came back that i got the opportunity to stay here. I have stayed in over 10+ different san diego hotels over the years and i have to say i have always wanted to stay here.... it was nice but i won't book again. Of course i knew it was going to be like staying in an antique among the titans of other hotels here. The location is in the heart of the gaslamp district of downtown san diego. There is no public parking and only valet is an option at $25.00 a day. Taxi from the airport will run you about $15.00. BE AWARE there is a 48 hour cancellation policy for every reservation. There is a restaurant on site but never opened due to the high vacancy rate. You are within walking distance to many restaurants & bars. BE AWARE internet doesn't work in all the rooms (i'm writing from the hallway right now). The A/C doesn't work in all the rooms turn it to the fan setting. There are ceiling fans in the rooms. Some rooms are noisier than others based on their locations to the nightclubs. There is no pool. No fitness center. No coffee maker in the room. No vending machines for snacks. No gift shop. No mini bar. There is soap shampoo and lotion and blow dryer on the wall in the bathroom. There is an ice machine but no bag for the bucket (old school) DO NOT STAY HERE AS A SINGLE WOMAN ON BUSINESS. The front desk gives out room numbers to the taxi companies and who knows what other vendors. The staff is stuffy and not very friendly but it fits the decor of this old landmark rebuilt in 1986. BE AWARE: if you book more than one night and cancel your reservation (ie switch hotels because you are not happy there is a significant penalty. $$$$) i love antiques and was blown away by the decor but you can always walk over from another property and check out the decor. i'm glad i got the opportunity to stay here this one time but three nights was 2 too many. I would think if you want one night with the honey here, then go for it. It is a romantic antique like setting.... get a balcony room. But don't stay for more than one night, its just not worth it with nothing to offer for the price but a cute armoire and headboard. If you come with no modern expectations you usually get with other hotels then will be ok here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MadDadSanJose
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff, reasonable rates. Very nice, I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: MacamoDC
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Horton Grand Hotel. It was more quaint and quirky than expected but our room was comfortable and pleasant. The hotel is conveniently located in the Gaslamp district and is only a few short blocks from the convention center. As with most older hotels, soundproofing is not great and we could easily hear noises from other rooms and the street. The staff were pleasant throughout our stay. Valet services were great and we had no problems getting our car in and out over our 3 night stay. Avoid the breakfast restaurant on premises - overpriced and not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davisrt
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Diego was on Memorial Day weekend and we could not have been more pleased with this hotel. The front desk was extremely helpful with suggestions and directions to other sites and events, and the room was exactly as advertised. Being right in the Gaslight District gave us plenty of good restaurants and live shows to see. Valet parking seemed expensive at first, but compared to the prices at parking garages nearby, it was well worth the price. Shannon at the front desk is a fountain of information, but everyone else seemed to be very willing to help us have a terrific weekend. Ross

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: dolivares44
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel situated right in the heart of the Gas Lamp District. The location is great and the rooms are not too bad for the age of the hotel but the service is horrible. We thought the hotel was pretty empty given its location but after experiencing the service there it made complete sense. We received bad service on 3 different occasions. 1st incident. At check in the lady was short and brief with us. We were told there was no restaurant or room service. Saturday morning we walked down and sure enough the hotel restaurant was open. The employee at the restaurant there was complaining that it was extremely slow and had no customers. We told her its due to the fact that the restaurant is not really promoted there and and sometimes told that there is no restaurant. Maybe its easier to say there isn't a restaurant then to give out their hours? The restaurant does not open on Mondays. 2nd incident was Saturday morning. I left the valet ticket in the mail box since i had to leave really early and my wife was still in the room. Wife came down and the lady at the front desk was busy on a personal call. Wife had to clear her throat a few times if you know what i mean. Then she was short and brief with my wife and told her she couldn't find the valet ticket. Once she looked in the mailbox where the valet guy said he was going to put it she found it. 3rd incident. Our friends checked out early on Saturday and were waiting for their vehicle at the valet area at the same time we were. The valet guy brought the car around and loaded the luggages with our friends help. The valet guy quickly left to get our vehicle since my wife and I had also been waiting. All good up to that point. As the valet guy went to get our vehicle our friends realized that they didn't tip him so they waited for him to come back. My friend tried to tip him and the valet guy rejected his tip. Apparently he was hurt because he didn't tip him right away? I thought that was hilarious but what he did was extremely rude. So to sum it all up the service is horrible and the employees there don't seem very happy to be working there. If your not big on customer service then this is the hotel for you. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and noicy, but great central location”
Reviews.Author: MissPiaDK
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with beautiful court yard. We booked a court yard room in the hope of it being quiet, but no such luck. One of San Diego's more popular clubs are right in front of the hotel and I was kept awake by party goers and later the couple next door... You can hear everything at this hotel. It is very charming but the bathrooms could do with an upgrade, and if you are a light sleeper - find another hotel. No internet available.

Reviews.Title: “Business”
Reviews.Author: polishgirl44
Reviews.Content: I really had a great time at my stay. Mrs. Paula, Sam, Greg, Shannon, Justin, I forgot the one gentlemens name. Mexican man. I really had a great time. The people are wonderful. Great customer Service. Ginny Ludwikowski

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: jodysd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Would absolutely stay there again. Great & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasfishin1234
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Horton Grand and cannot say enough just how great it was! It was conveniently close to the convention center where we were exhibiting, and also located right by some fantatsic restaurants and shopping area. The hotel staff is very friendly, courteous and was a complete pleasure to meet. The Horton Grand's motif has the warmth, character and charm from another period, and is beyond what a Hilton or Marriott hotel could hope to achieve. I absolutely loved everything about the hotel, the staff and my stay, and would not consider staying anywhere else but at the Horton Grand upon my next vist to San Diego. Thanks again for making it a memorable and wonderful stay with you! Sincerely, John

Reviews.Title: “Victorian, European Style, perfect location for Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: LawsyCoronado
Reviews.Content: I knew what we were getting in to with the Horton Grand, as it is one of the most Historical, interesting, old world and perfectly charming hotels in Gaslamp. Don't expect a lively bar scene, big flash flat screen TV's in the room, or massive walk in bathrooms. This is about location, location, location! Out the door, walk 30 yards left, Cafe 222, the hottest brekkie spot. Over 4 blocks to Vin de Syrah for a hidden gem of a Wine Bar, up to Altitude 2 blocks away to at the highest rooftop bar in San Diego. Next door, (yes...10 yards), Fluxx, the coolest dance chill lounge in town. So, save some $$$, get some history, walk to wherever and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to love this hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: ElyseAshton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had looked into the Horton Grand on a previous trip to San Diego, and were looking forward to staying there. When we arrived, we were offered an upgrade to a balcony room by the nice lady with long hair at the front desk. She warned us there would be a lot of noise from a neighboring nightclub. We accepted (being no strangers to noise!) and loved the room on the top floor. It was clean, charming, the bed was comfortable and, having brought along a little "white noise" gadget, the nightclub music and " whooping" did not disturb us. If you are sensitive to noise, there are plenty of rooms away from the nightclub and you are given plenty of warning. The next day, we went out early. I came back to drop off some purchases, and was asked by one of the housekeepers if we were checking out or staying. We'd had the "please make up this room" sign on the doorknob when we left in the morning. I told her we were staying, and then ran out to go to an early dinner. When we got in, later afternoon, the room still wasn't made up and there were no housekeepers to be seen. We had to start getting ready for an evening event and didn't want to have to vacate the room. I saw an abandoned housekeeping garbage/dirty linen cart in one of the halls when I was doing my "search", so we made the bed, I emptied the garbage into the large plastic bag, and threw the towels into the laundry cart . Couldn't find the clean towel cart, so my husband called down to the desk to say that the room had never been made up, and could we please have some clean towels. The desk person said yes, and in about forty-five minutes, a housekeeper came to the door with towels. She asked if we needed anything else, and I told her I had already taken out the trash, etc. She said, "Oh, thank you..." and went on to chat a bit. I have to say, even with nobody worried that our room was never cleaned, they were all very friendly and nice. The valets were great--really fast and asked if we needed directions when we were heading out. We consider including the valet parking charge as one of the costs of staying there. It's a busy downtown location and you don't want to spend valuable holiday time searching for parking. The restaurant in the hotel is closed Friday through Sunday, so we went a block away to Starbucks and brought back some breakfast to have on our balcony. A hotel bar is advertised, but we never saw anyone there. We saw people waiting for the valet with drinks, so I'd imagine if you asked at the desk, someone would make you a drink. Actually, we saw empty glasses on a small table near the elevators, and they were still there the next day, so there might be drinks somewhere, or people brought something back to their rooms. It would have be nice to have tea or coffee in the hotel without having to make the Starbucks run. There were some interesting displays around the hotel, and a sign offering tours followed by another sign saying "No more tours"! The hotel kind of had the feeling of being only partially staffed, there didn't seem to be many guests around, and it felt a little-- sad. It's such a lovely hotel, resonably priced, and I'd love to be able to recommend it, but to be honest, I'd have to say that I wouldn't be very tempted to return. The housekeeping thing may have been a fluke, and I'm sure if I'd have insisted, the room would have been cleaned after we left for the evening. As we were only staying a short weekend, and it was such a busy time, it seemed better to just roll with it....

Reviews.Title: “We very much enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: cbrRoseville
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to have the Daily Save special and what a deal it was for us. The hotel was friendly, the room was clean, and you cannot beat the location. I would stay there again without the Daily Save deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julia1130
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for NYE weekend 2010/2011 and had a great trip! The hotel is beautiful and charming - the room was very clean and we loved having a balcony and a fireplace - very romantic! It was chilly while we were there so we weren't able to enjoy the courtyard. On a final note - my boyfriend and I liked the sort of "haunted" feeling of the long hallways and "interesting" paintings in the upper levels...

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: r_watt741
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Horton Grand and found my visit to be very good. The staff were helpful and polite. The rooms were comfortable and clean but had no tea/coffee facilities. The breakfast was good and the hotel is perfectly located for the convention center which is only 5 min round the corner. I would definitely recommend this place. In particular the reception and breakfast staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for business travel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Gwen05
Reviews.Content: *Staff was very helpful and friendly *Large Rooms *Close to restaurants *Clean and friendly *Only drawback is the parking

Reviews.Title: “Awsome location but could use some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: Pooka99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of San Deigo. The few staff were friendly and helpful. It is a historic hotel and it needs some TLC. There is the largest night club located across the quiet street so watchout for noise on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, great customer service, outstanding bar, top notch hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gatorkc
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand Hotel is located near the civic center, water, great restuarants, walking distance to the trolly, train line and great entertainment. clean, historical and the bartenter has many interesting stories to tell about San Diego's history. We will return and stay at the Horton Grand...I would recomment this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mapratt13
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the history of the hotel, the cleanliness of the rooms, and the absolutely wonderful staff. The rooms were a little on the small size due to the age of the hotel, but wow - we had a balcony overlooking the courtyard. Will definitely be staying there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel makes you feel like you're far away from it all!”
Reviews.Author: AuntieEm59
Reviews.Content: Such a wonderful hotel. Rumored to be haunted (I didn't experience any ghost sightings) but definitely hauntingly beautiful. Unique decor, wonderful service, and a lovely courtyard. I couldn't believe the bargain price, either!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service in a Beautiful Building”
Reviews.Author: sibloom24
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the Horton Grand - the desk staff were extremely outgoing and made the hotel feel like home. The charms of the building - antique furniture, beautiful courtyard - enhanced my visit. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased:”
Reviews.Author: MayerCS
Reviews.Content: We have been conducting our mPro3 users conferences at the Horton Grand since 2006 The conference room is basic yet comfortable. Last minute requests have been handled promptly. Our attendees have enjoyed staying at the facility during the conferences. Being a Victorian style hotel. this prompts for some great conversation as exploring the facility and reviewing its history. In addition the location is excellent, everything is within walking distance. The Staff is very friendly and courteous - especially Justin.

Reviews.Title: “A charming step into the past”
Reviews.Author: SBange
Reviews.Content: The history of the hotel comes alive, as the decor and demeanor of hotel staff is played out for guests. I felt transported into the past as I entered our room; it was attired in pinks and sage greens, white wicker furniture, a fireplace, balcony with chairs, and period fixtures in the bathroom (including a water closet!). The hotel staff were gracious and helpful, answering each of my questions thoughtfully. While there, I attended 2 catered events -- a high tea in the dining room and an evening dessert mixer in the courtyard. Both were beautiful events, wonderfully catered. Located on the edge of the Gaslamp District and near the Convention Center, it was quiet, yet convenient. Just perfect for my needs! I had a wonderful time. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and cozy”
Reviews.Author: juliet1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights with some colleagues. I absolutely LOVED this hotel! When we checked in the two ladies at the front desk were not terribly friendly, but the rest of the staff couldn't have been more friendly and courteous. The hotel is full of period furniture off the landings of the grand staircase. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The toilet was noisy, but it only woke me up the first night (when I had left the bathroom door open). I had a balcony room facing the street & nightclub. My door would not open and the nightclub was very loud. I didn't use the air conditioner but the heat & fireplace worked very well. We knew ahead of time that the internet was not free, but it was very easy to access. The restaurant was open for breakfast beginning at 7am, but I left the hotel before it opened every day, so having a muffin available would have been wonderful. The hotel is located just off of the main Gaslamp street, so it was close enough to various shops/restaurants/convention center, but far enough where you didn't have the constant street traffic (if you don't include the club next door).

Reviews.Title: “The Horton Grand is superb, cozy rooms, great staff and close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: peoneil
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand is a great place to stay. On the edge of the Gaslamp District it is close to the action but situated on a side street of you can still get a peaceful night's sleep. The Staff is always ready to assist with any requests I had. The rooms are cozy, filled with antiques and a gas fireplace. This is always my first choice when staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Two day seminar on biomedical research techniques”
Reviews.Author: MarkJDenmark
Reviews.Content: We held a two day course for 20 biomedical research scientists at the Horton Grand Hotel in San Diego. The facilities for the course were excellent and the assistance with the practical aspects surpurb. Justin and Shannon at the front desk made the experience particularly enjoyable through their friendly, helpful presence.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value for your dollars.”
Reviews.Author: Carlitos283
Reviews.Content: Here is what you are not getting for their sizzling deal ($99/night) like they call it. Poor air conditioning, no free internet ($9.99), they have a sign that tells you how to connect, but I had to call at the reception to find out about the surcharge, no breakfast, no newspaper, no public phone, they used to have one but they took it out for money reason, no wine bottle opener, it took the lady at the front desk 10 minutes to find one and when she found it, she was hesitating on giving it to me saying that people never bring them back, ice machine on the 4th floor was broken, so I had to go down to 2nd floor. The windows in my room wouldn't open, 75 cents every time you make a phone call from your room. No comment cards at the reception or in the room. No paper and pen in the room to take notes. My last comment is overcharge for what you get. Don't expect much is you go there, a tv and a bed and you will be happy then

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: psychmitt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, tucked away but right in the middle of all the action of the gaslamp district. The service was good, fast, and friendly. A great place to stay if you want a convenient location, a quirky historic feel, and don't mind doing without amenities that a lot of the larger hotels can offer for a fee (ie. fitness center, restaurant, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start but Great Ending”
Reviews.Author: azmagic1
Reviews.Content: The Asian lady that checked us in on Sunday was so rude that we almost moved to another hotel. After she left, the staff was GREAT. The bar is beautiiful and the rooms are historic. A little trouble getting the temp in the room to balance and the toilet is extremely noisy. The restaraunt is excellent. Ida Baily herself would be proud. It was a little disappointing that they do not allow ghost touring of the haunted areas and that they have removed the "event diaries" from the rooms so you can't read about the spooky happenings before you arrived.

Reviews.Title: “old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Valerie82
Reviews.Content: like staying in an antique shop. Very old fashioned, is a little run down and understaffed. You can see that in used to be a fantastic hotel. The bedroom was small, comfortable and had an open gas fire. The internal coutyard was very nice for a drink in the evening. The worst thing was the noise from the nightculd right accross the street, dance music, shouting and fighting into the early hours. Double glazing would have made this less of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Charming indeed!”
Reviews.Author: rjc2112
Reviews.Content: My Honey had a conference recently at the convention center. As neither of us had been to San Diego in over 25 years, we combined the business trip with a little romantic getaway. The location was terrific for our needs. As others have noted, there are lots of dining options within a few minutes' walk, and the SDCC is perhaps 500 yards away. Our room (410) was very clean and very comfortable. The antique-looking dresser and armoire provided plenty of storage space for 2 staying less than a week. The television was cleverly sequestered in the wall behind a two piece mirror which opens out. The gas fireplace, while not particularly needed in August, provided a great deal of ambience... Checking in and out was painless, and every staff member we spoke with was very pleasant. The good news is that there was an ice machine right outside our door; the bad news is that it was out of service and the next nearest one is two floors down. Not a huge deal - I like stairs, and she REALLY likes stairs. There is a restaurant here (Ida Bailey's). Unfortunately the chef had recently departed, so the place was not open while we were there. There is also a neat looking little bar (the Palace Bar). Unfortunately again, its hours are directly related to how full the hotel is. Alas, during our stay it was not open in the afternoons or evenings, though I suspect they were having High Tea in the mornings. There are fascinating photos and antiques throughout the hotel, creating a kind of museum-like feeling. It was a great experience, and we would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Honesty”
Reviews.Author: CentralPointHealth
Reviews.Content: We give thanks to your team! Justin for his fast service and Norma for her quick and honest response. I left my purse, ID etc. in the room. She found it returned it and nothing was missing! Nice now a days! Pls give them a high 5!

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way, but centrally located!”
Reviews.Author: suz5060
Reviews.Content: The Horton Grand is a quiet respite from the hectic convention center area of San Dieago and within convenient walking distance. There are beautiful antiques throughout the hotel and lovely oak wood decor in the lobby. There is a good shopping and a great grocery store within walking distance, as well as a myriad of different restaurants. The staff were most accomodating and personable. Rates were reasonable. I would go back in a heartbeat. MABannen

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MattUTK
Reviews.Content: As we entered the lobby we felt as if we had stepped into an elegant portrait of history. The hotel is historic, charming, and delightful. My wife and I stayed there for our honeymoon and the staff treated us as if we were family. All members of the staff that we encountered were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. They went out of their way to ensure that our stay was and pleasant and memorable. Our balcony room had a beautiful view of the treetops in the courtyard and the gaslight district. The location is unbeatable! Right in the heart of the gaslight. We plan on several repeat visits to the Horton Grand for anniversaries in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to convention center and not the traditional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lheiskell
Reviews.Content: Every year for San Diego Comic-Con, you play the hotel lottery. This year we landed at the Grand Horton Hotel. The staff was very friendly and the hotel is quite unique. Check out the surprise display when taking the elevator. In the midst of all the new construction in the Gaslamp, it was very refreshing to see a historical hotel with large rooms, great atrium and lots of funky staircases. Even during the hectic Comic-con, the hotel was always quite and calm - very relaxing. Get the large suite.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: mommy2mads
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the 2010 Comicon through the Comicon's website to qualify for the group rate. We had picked the hotel we wanted to stay at plus two alternates, but when our window to bid on a hotel came we had to add more selections and ended up clicking on this hotel based solely on its proximity to the convention center. What a mistake! Please, don't make the same one we did. It was like staying at your great-great aunt's spare bedroom complete with the dusty closet odor.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Relaxing and Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: grlshaka
Reviews.Content: I come to San Diego once yearly for the giant comic book convention and I wouldn't stay anywhere but the Horton Grand. I used to roam the other, bigger hotels during my 13 years of going to con, but once I found this one about five or six years ago, I never looked back. First, the staff: They are all super nice and efficient. A couple of them are also hilarious. Any questions they've got answers pronto, checking in/out is a breeze, and if for some reason you need a cab, it's there in moments. The staff is there if you need them, and leave you alone if you clearly want to be left alone. Second, the rooms: They are comfortable and cute. I very much appreciate the option to do a small part for the environment by not having your sheets laundered every day. (I wash my sheets once weekly at home. This is the same thing.) For me, a person who can't stand air conditioning, it's fabulous that if you turn off the air when you leave, it's still off when you get back! It's also very quiet and peaceful in the rooms and the hotel in general. This is not a party hotel, which I very much appreciate. When I get off the giant, sensory overload exhibit floor that is Comic-Con, I want peace & quiet and no random loud parties popping up in the next room. When I get to my hotel, I know I can fully relax and actually sleep. Third, the building: I love being in an historic space and wandering around early morning or late at night looking at all the details. After several years staying there, 2010 was the first time I noticed the beautiful 17th-century carriage under the staircase on the second floor! The restoration job on the place is excellent, and the displays all throughout the place are wonderful. Fourth, the location: For me, it's a perfect location. Step out the door and to my left is Cafe 222, my fave breakfast spot. To my right is a bank with two working ATMs and rarely any line, a critical need for the convention. I'm steps away from Sushi Nippon, The Field and The Cheese Shop (which also delivers to the Horton Grand if you're too lazy to walk 1.5 blocks). There is also an independent mini-grocery half a block away for when you discover you forgot to pack your toothpaste or lost another lighter. And of course it's within easy striking distance of the convention center, especially if you cut through the parking lot on Second Ave. Simply put, the Horton Grand Hotel has absolutely everything I need in a hotel for Comic-Con. Because I haven't quite kicked the habit yet, I do wish there was an ashtray somewhere out front. The Horton Grand, like most hotels these days, is a non-smoking facility. The closet space is period-correct, so bring your own hangars if you have too many outfits!

Reviews.Title: “A unique gem in the middle of cookie cutter high rises”
Reviews.Author: EllisMarche
Reviews.Content: I had no idea what to expect from this hotel. It was beyond charming. You get the feel of San Diego's history and it's the only hotel I've ever stayed in (and I've stayed in many with business traveling) that made me want to explore. You feel like you're coming home to a small apartment not some sterile hotel room. Loved that every room is probably unique, ours had a gorgeous dresser and chest of drawers. The dioramas in the elevators were certainly something different. Walking though the lovely courtyard every day was lovely as well. If you want to stay in a sterile shoebox and have to listen to doors slam and elevators groan all night, go stay in one of the chains. If I have my pick next year, I'll be staying at the Horton Grand again. My only complaint, no free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Time to clean up the act there”
Reviews.Author: bick2010
Reviews.Content: A very unique hotel with some very cool history...but who sleeps in a museum with deferred maintenance? The armoire in our room was broken, musty smell in the hallways, noisy ac, and being across from the Flux night club pretty much guarantees you won't be sleeping until 2 AM or so. Their website, like their maintenance and old 19 inch TV's need updated. There is no tea, and the "dining" is basically breakfast, not that there aren't a ton of places to eat in the area. You would think that you could at least get coffee included in the deal. We were on our way out and poured ourselves a couple cups from the self-service on the bar area when much to our surprise a server appeared from nowhere and asked us for $7. A fitting end to our first and last stay there. We'll stick to the Solimar next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read 0n their website.”
Reviews.Author: MA2FAB4
Reviews.Content: I was in SD for a convention and picked this hotel for its price, proximity to the convention center and the restaurant in the hotel. I often work evenings when traveling and it's convenient to eat in the hotel. I went down on Tuesday night to an empty dining room - when I asked the front desk clerk why no one in the restaurant I was told the kitchen hadn't been open for a couple of months - forget the high tea on weekends too. That doesn't happen anymore either. The kitchen was open for breakfast and the granola was good - but the room was very dusty (the black piano shows it badly) and there was a small table in the middle of the room with dirty, empty vases - I kept thinking someone would get rid of it - but it was there every day. I like shabby chic - but this was just shabby. I could see that the carpets under the chairs in the "parlor" outside my area on the third floor hadn't been vacumed in a very long time. The "new orleans style courtyard" had a "Private Function - by invitation only" sign in front of the closed doors the whole time I was there. This did not live up to either the other reviews or their website.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rsdunphy
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! My wife and I stayed at the Horton grand hotel in San Diego, ca. the hotel is an unbelievable experience. It will take you back in time when San Diego was a wide open town, just getting started and everyone had the outlook that this is where a person can make their mark. San Diego is no different today, and the Horton grand hotel exemplifies this. The rooms are very quaint, very comfortable and affordable. There is no room service, but then, you do not come to this hotel expecting all the refinements of the big hotel chains. You come to this hotel to relax in an atmosphere that is missing from other hotels. The staff at the Horton grand hotel is the best. They all made me feel right at home. I was there for 2 weeks of business with nighttime activities of ghost hunting. They did not mind us wandering the hallways after midnight. They also produced for me a small refrigerator so I could have cold items in the room at all times. The tv channels are close to what we have at home with our cable service. Almost all the channels are there. This is very uncommon in a San Diego hotel. All in all, this was a very enjoyable place to stay and enjoy old town San Diego, California

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quaint Hotel ina very good location”
Reviews.Author: CossyWombat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with my wife and three sons and found it to be very comfortable and unusual. It is a very quaint and interesting hotel built in the 1920s and has retained that old world charm. It does need some attention in the plumbing department with slow drains and showers, but the rooms are large and well appointed and above all comfortable. I would go back if we were to go back to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Our eclectic family will return again and again to this one-of-a-kind quiet hotel in the CENTER of the gaslamp action!”
Reviews.Author: Coyoteme
Reviews.Content: We were sad to leave the hotel; we'd enjoyed our stay and knew our stay could not be duplicated anywhere else. The Horton Grand Hotel is authentic, in a GREAT location, and comes complete with the best rates in town AND a caring staff that made every logistic (in an unfamiliar city) simply simple! Immediately upon check in, Shannon aclimated us to the city and helped get us going...every time we saw her she interpreted our needs (and we all know when traveling as a cross-country family gathering for a rare get-together our needs were diverse) and each return to the hotel was like a return home. Valet parking was extremely convenient; Justin always helpful and skilled in hospitality. Bottom line, the Horton Grand is the new favorite - they'll be seeing us again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but they grossly over-charged me”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for the General Meeting of the American Society for Microbiology. The Horton Grand is close to the Convention Center. The neighborhood is charming with plenty of good food, museums, etc. close by. The staff were quite friendly and able to amswer a lot of questions about the historic district. I was placed in a room with a handicap bath that was otherwise very small with a view of the dumpster. They charged me a convention rate of $179 when I now see the same room on their web site for $139. I would recommend checking the prices and seeing the room before moving in. (There is no pool or exercise room ...a lot of money for just a room.)

Reviews.Title: “Horton Grand-not for some PERFECT for others”
Reviews.Author: dmhsupermom
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. If you want a pool and gym go somewhere else. If you want Victorian charm, a spotlessly clean room, and a comfortable bed in a great location this is the place for you. My room had a balcony overlooking the courtyard and a fireplace. I enjoyed them both. The room was kind of small but did contain a king size bed. I was traveling alone and didn't really mind the overall comfort of the room made up for the lack of size. This was one of my all time favorite hotel rooms. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Hotel is spectaculer”
Reviews.Author: ReverendD
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is quaint, with a wonderful friently and helpful staff. The hotel had an elevator, but I chose to walk 4 floors because of the peaceful energy of the hotel. I don't normally like antiques, but this hotel was Grand and I'm so thankful I found it. It was very homey, not like the much larger hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: volunteer4
Reviews.Content: Every Spring 2 girlfriends and I vacation in a city we've never visited. I have to admit after making our reservations, I read the reviews and was a bit concerned. Upon arrival we were greeted by a great staff who were helpful with directions, fun things to do, and great places to eat. The location was amazing, out our front door and to the right we could catch the ole town trolley, straight ahead and every possible food was within walking distance (Irish, Italian, Japanese, American, whatever your choice). Our room was in the new addition and was extremely roomy....king bed, sofa bed, large bathroom with amenities, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Definitely ask for one of the suites....the other rooms are much older and have not yet been renovated . Highly recommend! Would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: lukedynowski
Reviews.Content: After staying in hundreds of chain hotels offering the same look and feel, walking into the Horton was a breath of fresh air, the place oozes old school charm, our room was like something from a period drama complete with fireplace and high ceilings. Its location could not be better being just off the Gaslamp quarter meaning you have all the fun stuff on your doorstep whilst being quiet in the evenings and only a short walk to trams and bus stops. The staff were friendly, helpful and offered lots of advice on the city and made the stay an enjoyable experience. Also despite there being so many restaurants on your doorstep the hotel does very good food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience - Will return again”
Reviews.Author: TOMnLYNNE
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Horton Grand. Our first was an impromptu gift from our son and daughter-in-law. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we returned with friends. The rooms are decorated in late 19th and early 20th century. Even to the water box above the toilet with a pull chain to flush. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. Our morning coffee from room service (there is no in room coffee) was prompt. Rooms have a small two chair balcony. Both times we stayed in rooms 419 and 420. These rooms have a connecting door, great for families. Room 418 and 419 have connected balconies and I think this would be better for friends traveling together. The balconies overlook an interior/exterior courtyard with full grown ficus trees; interior to the hotel, exterior to the world. The higher floors (there are only 4) have a pretty good view of the city as well. Be sure and check out the stairway. The first time we stayed, the kitchen was only open for breakfast on weekends. This last time they had opened the kitchen for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The chef is a graduate of the culinary institute in Hyde Park, NY. We had previous plans so we did not partake, but next time we surely intend to do so. As I said, we WILL return.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect value for the conference traveler, or for anyone wanting a nice place to stay without the hefty price tag!”
Reviews.Author: StairMaster2010
Reviews.Content: The group I stayed at the Horton Grand with required more than just rooms to sleep in. We had 2 all-day meetings at the hotel that required A/V, morning coffee service, and a full buffet lunch for 60 people. The rooms we met in were comfortable and just the right size, the A/V person was very attentive, and the buffet lunch got rave reviews! The sleeping rooms were clean and comfortable for a great price tag for the location. The hotel is a bit creaky and lacks noise insulation, but overall my group is glad that we stayed in the Horton Grand.

Reviews.Title: “A charming stay that took me to America during the early years of the West.”
Reviews.Author: GabrielleHubbard
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is beautifully ornate. The enclosed patio is open and inviting with seating to enjoy the statues and other works of art. The hotel was furnished with beautiful antique furniture that was a delight to the eye. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The adjoining restaurant was equally stylish and served excellent food by a charming staff. Our room was lovely antique furnishings and had a view from the window of the Gaslamp section of San Diego. We were within walking distance to many restaurants and other attractions, including San Diego Bay with maritime museums, the Midway aircraft carrier and Seaport Village. The trolley was close and we walked to Little Italy; a special treat for my friend who has visited Italy and said the it was just like being in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/atmosphere, Watch Parking!”
Reviews.Author: JennyLind
Reviews.Content: If you like an old fashion type of hotel stay - fireplace and balcony, this is the hotel for you. Great location in Gas Lamp district. Now the problem...We were told that we could park for free in certain areas and this is true. However, they did not warn us to look for the hard to see "street sweeping" signs. $40.00 parking ticket! When we asked the morning desk clerk about this, his reply..."Haven't you ever been in a city." How insulting. Ruined what could have been a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Character and Service This is our kind of place.”
Reviews.Author: localNorthSandiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our favorate place to stay in the Gas Lamp District.

Reviews.Title: “Great area, historical charm, cute rooms but no extras”
Reviews.Author: woodyjen99
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was New Year's Eve and it's right in the Gaslamp, so location is prime. The hotel is built in 1800's and the hotel itself is pretty neat, with old mixed with new. Our room had a cute balcony overlooking the courtyard and had a killer San Diego skyline view. The room was spacious with fireplace and cool molding, old bed and bathroom fixtures that added to the history. The room was clean and tidy. The price was great, especially for last minute booking. $178/night for New Year's Eve. The down side is the valet line was about 11 cars long. Thankfully my hubby and I parked across the street in the parking garage, which was great after we heard the wait was 1 hour for the valet and there was only one person. You'd think they'd get more people for a holiday. Similarly, the line to check in was long because there was only 1 woman at front and she wasn't overly friendly or apologetic for the wait. And the hotel did not have any extras. Even though the website shows a restaurant, there is none, even though the phones show room service, there is none, no book in the room to explain anything and no soaps or toiletries, and the fixed shampoo container was empty. These may be petty to some but it's pretty much a standard at hotels less than this one (i.e Comfort Inn). And it was loud. It was New Year's Eve so we just dealt with it but we could hear every bump and sound of the rooms near us. Overall it was perfect for what we needed - a place to crash for the night. The fan squeaked the whole time but the bed was comfy and again, it felt clean in the room. And the price was good for the holiday and the type of room we received.

Reviews.Title: “An old Eueopean-style Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niemand
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a Hyatt or even a "Best Western". But for genteel 19th century European service and unique and classy decor, you can't beat the Horton Grand. We had none of the bad experiences with hotel staff that some other reviewers mention -- everybody was helpful, pleasant and prompt. The location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “surprising”
Reviews.Author: Krysia054
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Horton Grand Hotel which was touted to be a boutique hotel I was so disappointed. The lobby was so outdated and shabby I could not suppress my disappointment. After having to change our room after the first night in which they put us in a room next to the bar and under an elephant (very old and the floors are really creaky) and next to an adjoining room separated by a thin door it felt like our neighbours were in bed with us. The room we spent the rest of our holiday in was on the top floor (no elephants) and the only noise was the sound of the elevator because they put us next to the electrical room it turned out to be a nice place to stay. Staff was really accommodating, price was right but definitely calling it a boutique hotel is being very kind.

Reviews.Title: “historical (old), elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbcpy
Reviews.Content: it's elegant every piece of furniture, art work, even the carpet in the hotel and the room. it's historical which means it's old, so the ac is loud in the room and it could be noisy when your neighbor is taking a shower. but overall, it's a very nice hotel no wonder many U.S. Presidents have stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: JLK_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a recent business trip. The room was fine, and I enjoyed the Victorian touches. Small things you might expect elsewhere were missing, however. Pens/writing paper not in desk, no wastebasket by desk, etc. No business center, no room service. It has a bar/dining room, but it seemed closed at all times of the day and evening. Fortunately, there are several good restaurants within a block. It also seemed like there were a lot of homeless people in the neighborhood. Front desk people were friendly and tried to be helpful but they lack infrastructure. They have no internet access at the front desk, so I had to e-mail a boarding pass I needed printed to a manager- who faxed it to the front desk. The bar code turned out to be unreadable. The hotel seemed very empty when I was there, so it was fairly quiet. However, my sense is that the walls are thin and the doors do not seal all that well. If it was busy, it could be a noisy place to stay. I was like a ghost hotel, which was fine with me, but I have to wonder about its long term future.

Reviews.Title: “"Victorian" = Needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: SeminolePride03
Reviews.Content: We were walked from the Hyatt Manchester Grand, an amazing hotel on the water, to this dump. Even the hotel staff at the Hyatt apologized, saying it was literally the last hotel in the city with rooms available. There was a huge convention over the 4th of July holiday, and everywhere was sold out. When we walked into the hotel, you could just tell it has never been renovated and the white wicker and chintz furniture spoke volumes. When we got to our room, the smell of mothballs almost knocked us over when we opened the door. I don't think anyone had stayed in that room in the past 6 months. We asked housekeeping to spray air freshener, which they did, but it still didn't mask the smell. After a while I actually got a headache from it. Overall, the atmosphere there is just horrible. It's just so old. We felt like at any moment the elevator was going to trap us going to our room, or the fireplace in our room that never turned off was going to burn the entire place down. My recommendation, if this is your last resort, cross the border and stay in Mexico. It's got to be better there...

Reviews.Title: “Cute and full of character”
Reviews.Author: boombox9
Reviews.Content: I opted to stay here instead of at the Manchester Grand Hyatt, where my conference was held, in order to escape the masses of business people and relax at night in a great location. This place is optimally located and charmingly decorated. My room had a fireplace and lots of great old-fashioned details to give it a very cozy feeling. No problems at all during the stay, and I still have fond memories of the place, years later.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the night desk clerk!”
Reviews.Author: MrTravel19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Horton for 4 days. Upon check in, once the elevator arrived at the third floor we were greeted by a glass enclosed scene of old-fashioned stuffed dummies that reminded me of Chucky of movie fame. It was scary. I hated to take that particular elevator again. Once we got to our tiny, tiny, tiny room we found it to be about 80+ degrees. But after turning on the air conditioning, a mere 24 hours later the room reached a comfortable temperature. The bathroom was the smallest I've ever experienced but it was clean. The only other negative about the bathroom was the toilet. It's been a while since I encountered a toilet with a wooden tank that sits high on the wall... but that's what they had. Over the days I even got used to the loud whooshing noise it made each time it was flushed. In fact it was so loud you dare not flush it at night because you'll surely wake your spouse... and maybe even the people in adjoining rooms. But the real negative was the way the water in the uncovered tank splashed in your face when it was flushed. I guess in retrospect the toilet splash had more pressure than the shower. But the real nightmare was the desk clerk at 4:00 AM on September 2, 2009. We had to catch an early flight and each day as we met a new desk clerk we asked if getting our valet parked car at 4:00 AM was going to be a problem since the valet is only there once in a while. They assured us it wasn't going to be a problem. Well they were all wrong. When we got to the front desk there was nobody there. There was a roughly scribbled sign that said will be back in 5 minutes or call [--]. After 5 minutes I called the number and got a lady who said she was in the parking garage down the street but she would be there in 2 minutes. After 10 minutes she finally showed up and was the meanest nastiest desk clerk I've ever encountered. She berated me for being concerned about making my flight. I told her I'd tell the Western Foodservice Expo staff of my experience and she threateneds to call the police for threatening her. She seemed to be crazy but maybe it was just a drug induced rage or something of that nature.
